tags: i will NEVER be over this
summary: They didn’t have to make Dany mad.
body:
They didn’t have to make Dany mad.

If D&D really wanted to kill Dany to have Bran sit on the throne, they didn’t have to make her mad. They could have just as easily had her die heroically in battle against the Others which would have served their “bittersweet” ending. Dany would remain a hero and her heroic sacrifice could have inspired others to be better rulers.

Their choice to make her mad tells me that they were planning on killing her all along and they needed a reason to justify her death. “You can’t blame us for killing her! She killed thousands of innocent people! ShE’s MaD!!!1!!” They knew that people would be angry about her death (because there’s no way they are oblivious to how many people love Dany) so they preemptively made her do something so horrible that the audience wouldn’t be able to help but agree with her death.

Bullshit.

We can and will blame them for this misogynistic writing, because they made the choice to turn her “mad.” Fictional characters don’t act of their own volition, therefore writers are responsible for the choices made by the characters they write.

The choice to have her commit mass genocide was nothing more than a kick in the face to Dany fans (a LARGE portion of the audience) and a twisted, mysoginistic revenge fantasy that only serves those who are already in power.

I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

summary: I can imagine some red priest resurrecting Daenerys and her reuniting with the Unsullied and the Dothraki and seeking an...
body:
I can imagine some red priest resurrecting Daenerys and her reuniting with the Unsullied and the Dothraki and seeking an alliance (again) with the Ironborn and the Dornish and returning to Westeros to fuck shit up and overthrow Bran.

I mean, they kind of set up this scenario in the finale. Yara is not happy Jon killed Daenerys and the Dornish prince seems to be so over everyone’s bullshit. Besides the Unsullied and the Dothraki are alive and well and relatively close to Volantis and lets be honest, Westeros’ political climate seemes unstable af. There’s no way it will last beyond a few months.

A “mad” warrior Queen, an angry dragon and thousands of fierce warriors? Yeah, #ForTheThrone 2.0

tags: grey worm was the last of the real ones
summary: I adore how protective Grey Worm always was over Dany. I’m not just talking about him as the captain of the Unsullied protecting...
body: I adore how protective Grey Worm always was over Dany. I’m not just talking about him as the captain of the Unsullied protecting her from her adversaries, I’m also talking about how protective he was over who she lets into her life and inner circle. He always had a healthy skepticism of Jorah, especially after it was revealed that he had betrayed Dany. It was the same with Tyrion. He never trusted Daario because people like Daario can never truly be trusted. And he distrusted Jon as well – maybe the only character in the entire show to distrust good ol’ Jon Snow. Grey Worm had impeccable instincts and he was always keeping a watchful eye on the men Dany associated with. But this protectiveness was always platonic, which is what makes it so sweet. Grey Worm was never in love with Dany – unlike Jorah, Tyrion, Daario and Jon. He just genuinely wanted what was best for his queen and friend, and that is beautiful.

He never trusted Daario because people like Daario can never truly be trusted. And he distrusted Jon as well – maybe the only character in the entire show to distrust good ol’ Jon Snow. Grey Worm had impeccable instincts and he was always keeping a watchful eye on the men Dany associated with. But this protectiveness was always platonic, which is what makes it so sweet. summary: the theory about tyrion being a bastard targaryen it's just another theory to take one dragon from dany to tyrion because she...
question: the theory about tyrion being a bastard targaryen it's just another theory to take one dragon from dany to tyrion because she has too much problem and some people are not okay with their faves not having this kind of power and dragons lol
answer: While I sort of agree where some of the Tyrion Targaryen supporters come from, you’re making a very good point. Too bad for them Tyrion is Tywin’s son.
